2.7.23  3:55 pm   if you draw a square on a peice of paper what is the average size that you draw it

      about 11.1% of the total area of the paper

2.7.23  3:13 pm   is "and the day goes on" a metaphor for anything because it feels like it is

      any decent song should have strong metaphoric qualities. for me, that particular song has perseverance vibes. also has joy and confidence

2.7.23  3:11 pm   do you feel safe nearby cats?

     sometimes

      can i see pictures of cats if you have them?

      i don't have any right now, but in the meantime you can go ahead and log on to the internet

2.7.23  2:27 pm   Do you think of yourself as a busy person?

     sometimes

      And does having the mindset of being a busy person effect people in a certain way?

     yes

      I'm wondering if maybe I should stop identifying with that label and think of something more fun. 

     being busy is very exciting and invigorating for a certain period of time. eventually it might get absolutely exhausting. but then it's nice to bring it back after a period of time feeling very unbusy

2.7.23  1:48 pm   do you do your own music?

      yes

2.7.23  11:07 am   if you had to divide the 12 months into 2 piles of 6 months each, based on criteria of your choice, how would you do it?

      january, and february. 6 januarys and 6 februarys

      just about

2.7.23  12:14 am   What deep thoughts or strong feelings do you have about walls, floors, and ceilings?

      they make the room. and the room is where it all happens. so, in conclusion, walls floors and ceilings make where it all happens

2.6.23  10:19 pm   You've just discovered a new color. What do you name it?

      that all depends what it looks like

2.6.23  8:55 pm   why did one of your videos appear in my dreams?

      because some of them appeared while you were awake

2.6.23  8:31 pm   where is Wyoming located

      i don't recall

2.6.23  7:38 pm   Any thoughts on your next video?

      it's good, but the next ones after that are equally important

2.6.23  5:44 pm   How to develop taste

      just keep tasting things

2.6.23  4:41 pm   what to do when what i want to do in the future keeps changing? i have less time to decide and plan the more my future changes

      enjoy the ride. if you've ever been on one of the non-changing timelines you'll recall it's excrutiating

2.6.23  3:22 pm   You said "when it comes, it's a gift" and "it waits until you least expect it" about music (and humor).

I often have this feeling, and I even have good ways to catch the "seed of the gift" by writing it down or by recording myself singing/playing, accurately enough to be able to reconstruct it.

However, I can reconstruct the music but not the feeling/vibe/enthusiasm and it seems dull afterwards and I give up. It seems that a good solution is to continue no matter what (not expecting to be fed by the "good feeling" while working on it),

     sometimes yes

      but then i'm afraid that if I work in a "bored" state then I will make "boring" music.

Do you have any thoughts, opinions or whatever about this?

      i think it's a fair idea. as i was saying, music loves to strike unexpectedly. and it seems you're already analyzing whether you should or should not continue if you are not 'feeling it'. So therefore, it becomes a good idea to continue anyway, because, again, that increases the likelihood that you will forget how hard you're trying

2.6.23  3:03 pm   why did you started using 3d animations,

     i wrote a history video that included a constant barrage of geographical locations all over planet earth. a flat map would definitely ruin the vibe for that, so i had to look into 3D

     and when did you started uploading videos with a Z-Axis?

      2017

2.6.23  2:48 pm   are some parts of more than a dream in 7/4?

      sure. i think on a chart i'd probably say alternating 3/4 and 4/4 (for those parts), but it adds up the same

2.6.23  2:34 pm   how do you feel about "at the airport terminal"?

     pretty good

     Do you like how it turned out? 

     some of it

2.6.23  1:23 pm   how to make original songs. i feel like any attempt at writing ends up being too similar to any song i know well/have heard recently

      try making it way way way way way way different. you can temporarily suspend the requirement that it's supposed to be good, if that helps you venture further outside the box. the music has such a strong desire to get good anyway that it will surprise you. so, the further you can launch yourself outside, the more rewarding the journey will be

2.6.23  10:55 am   what's your favorite inaudible pitch

      0hz

2.6.23  9:24 am   Is songwriting necessarily harder than poetry?

      no

2.6.23  7:54 am   do you speak Portuguese?

      no. but i can tell it apart from spanish as soon as i see 'çao'

2.6.23  7:12 am   what is psychologically wrong with me

      maybe you got a 3rd duck, which means they are no longer automatically in a row by default

2.6.23  6:33 am   Do you own a helicopter?

      no but i've heard of them

2.6.23  5:41 am   where is the human trait of curiosity in our metamodern world?

      all over it

2.6.23  4:05 am   I have been making instrumental music for a little while now, and I wanna start making songs with lyrics. Would you recommend I start with writing lyrics and then make a song to match those lyrics, or should I write the instrumental first, and then add lyrics?

      those are 2 different ways of doing it, and i think they are both tied for second best. the real fun starts when you think of the lyrics and music at the exact same time. they mean everything to each other. so if you keep them separate, it will be like more of a long-distance relationship

2.5.23  11:32 pm   are you avant-garde?

      how about à frente do jogo

2.5.23  10:52 pm   please may we see some unused lyrics from I Like To Wear Soft Clothing (Cause It Makes Me Feel Like I'm Rough, In Comparison)?

      it's the first note of the tune
      it's a long note but it's muted

2.5.23  9:25 pm   what is the 100th word in the next video?

     'your'

     if there aren't 100 words, then how about the 20th

2.5.23  9:19 pm   why in "i'm a huge gamer most of the time" video you reference physical games more than video games even though the lyrics and word gamer reference video games?

      because using more classic/physical games is more fun to model, more recognizable, and in most cases more legal

2.5.23  7:59 pm   I asked a question recently regarding my tendency to make excuses to not pursue something, but it looks like it wasn't answered, so I'll ask something similar. In general, do you think it's more beneficial to spend significant time to make an ideal plan to follow, or to iterate through several lackluster plans very quickly? I really want to know what you think

      if you spend a lot of time trying to make the perfect plan it might not connect well to actual reality. the more experience you get, the better you will be at making plans. so it depends how much experience you have in what you're doing. if you don't have much experience, then make smaller plans. But the option you mentioned for smaller plans also called them 'lackluster' which i don't think is really fair. Why did you not allow yourself the option of making small plans that are also good

2.5.23  7:26 pm   im having a super duper bad day when does it get better i cant remember

      pretty soon

2.5.23  4:07 pm   can you write my lab report

      no

2.5.23  1:03 pm   what is the greatest wisdom that is so simple, nobody considers it when considering wisdom

      the reflexive property of equality. a=a. that's the rule that proclaims that things are equal to themselves. this phenomenon so vitally important and all-encompasing that it sometimes seems totally invisible because it's so uselessly obvious

2.5.23  11:47 am   Gonna go to the store, do you need anything? 

      yes can you get me some answers

2.5.23  10:58 am   (in C Lydian) the notes played together are C, E, and F#. what do you call this chord? it can't be C(b5)

     sure it can

      because F# is the fourth of Lydian and not the fifth, and because i can add a G right next to the F# and i'll be damned if that G is an Abb

     i suppose you have a choice: Cmaj(b5), and i promise you there is nothing illegal about calling it that. it happens normally in the real world. (and you can still use F# on the staff in the melody if it goes there). Or, if you insist on preserving the "#4" aspect in the chord symbol, you can say Cmaj(add#4,no5). Although i guarantee if you use the second choice on a chart and give it to a player, you are much much more likely to get a pause and confused looks on the first runthrough. where as if you use Cmaj(b5) it increases the chances significantly that they will actually play what you wanted, the first time through. Sure, it's nice to adhere to proper scale numbering / good enharmonics when you can, but sooner or later you run into edge cases where you have to submit to F#=Gb. There are many more extreme cases, but this is an important one that seems to hit home for you

2.5.23  10:46 am   most recent chord trick you learned?

      making an animated character play chords

2.5.23  10:19 am   Do you have any deep thoughts or strong feelings about walls, floors, and ceilings?

      yes i do

2.5.23  5:55 am   how to reject conversation without seeming rude?

      how about getting a "sorry we're closed" sign

2.5.23  12:43 am   why is humor so easy but hard?

      when it comes, it's a gift. like music, it doesn't like not feeling like a gift. so if you push too hard for it, it loses its 'giftyness' and refuses to show. it waits until you least expect it, and then it shows up, as a gift. So the easy part is getting this gift. the hard part is trying so hard for it, and scaring it away for a while

2.5.23  12:01 am   Is there hope for me?

      yep

2.4.23  8:44 pm   do you ever just listen to a song on repeat because it's that good

      yep

2.4.23  7:03 pm   did all the genres melt?

      they only ever freeze for 1 song. each song is an opportunity to freeze the genres. in that moment, it feels as if you have a genre. but once the song's over, it's all melted down again and you can freeze it another way in the next song
